STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 4, 2025
MATTHEW THOMAS KUZMA
KALAMAZOO COUNTY DHHS
427 E Alcott St,
Kalamazoo, MI, 49001-6170
RE: License#: CP390201215
Dear MATTHEW THOMAS KUZMA:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 2/19/25 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human

Kalamazoo, MI 49001-6170
Agency Telephone #: 2693375000
Original Issuance Date: 09/10/1993

children in foster home, Supervise
Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and
make a licensing recommendation to the
department at least 15 calendar days before the
expiration date of the foster home license.
1 of 6 open Foster Home files reviewed contained a renewal recommendation not
provided to the department at least 15 days prior to the license expiring.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (d) Consideration of the factors identified
in R 400.12404(4).
1 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed did not contain documentation that
all factors required per R 400.12404(4) were considered at replacement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal 2/7/2023, CAP Approved 2/22/2023

CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (f) Notification to the parents, referral
source, lawyer guardian ad litem, and
courts when applicable, of the change in
placement.
1 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed did not contain documentation of
notification to parents, referral source, GAL and court at replacement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal 2/7/2023, CAP Approved 2/22/2023
Interim 2/16/2024, CAP Approved 3/12/2024
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (g) Information about the child was
shared with the new placement,
consistent with the requirements of R
400.12417.
2 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed did not contain documentation that
all required information per R 400.12417 was provided to the caregiver at
replacement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal 2/7/2023, CAP Approved 2/22/2023
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:

• (i) That the current foster parent was
notified in writing of the following
information:
• (i) Not less than 14 calendar days
in advance, of the change, except
when prior notification would
jeopardize the child's care or
safety. If prior notice is not
provided, then the agency shall
notify the foster parent, at the time
of the change, why prior notice
was not given.
1 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed did not contain documentation of
notification to caregiver at least 14 days prior to replacement.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (i) That the current foster parent was
notified in writing of the following
information:
• (ii) Of the current foster parent's
rights concerning the change in
placement.
1 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed did not contain documentation of
notification to caregiver of their rights regarding replacement.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (f) A dental re-examination must be
obtained at least every 9 months, unless
a greater frequency is indicated.

1 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed contained documentation that a
periodic dental exam was not completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
2 of 11 open youth files reviewed (6FC, 3IL) contained updated service plans not
completed timely.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal 2/7/2023, CAP Approved 2/22/2023
Interim 2/16/2024, CAP Approved 3/12/2024
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (3) When case responsibility changes from 1
child placing agency to another child placing
agency, a modified service plan must be
completed within 30 calendar days of the
change in agency responsibility if no other plan
is done within 30 days. The plan must address
why the agency responsibility changed and
whether there are any modifications to existing
service plans.
1 of 11 open youth files reviewed (6FC, 3IL) did not contain a modified service
plan completed within 30 days of change in agency.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit
the foster child, and the foster parent, if
applicable, in the child's placement at least once
every month.

1 of 8 open Foster Care youth files reviewed did not contain documentation of
visits with the youth in the youth's placement for one month.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Cited as 400.12421(b), Renewal 2/7/2023, CAP Approved 2/22/2023
Interim 2/16/2024, CAP Approved 3/12/2024
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Borrowed Bed- Get access to file prior to placement.
• Enrolled Foster Homes- Enter contacts and documents as
completed/received.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The one Special Evaluation report in which maltreatment in care was

established was completed thoroughly and resulted in the appropriate
recommendation of revocation.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The first CAP submitted by the agency was approved 7/24/2024 and was
submitted in response to the 2024SIC0001473 Special Investigation Report dated
7/11/2024.The one violation established during the investigation was related to the
agency's failure to obtain a variance for a foster home in violation of a rule
requirement, timely. The CAP was successfully implemented and there have been
no repeated violations.
The second CAP submitted by the agency was in response to the 2024 interim
licensing inspection dated 2/16/2024 and was approved on 3/12/2024. That CAP
addressed 11 violations, 3 of which were policy violations no longer regulated
during licensing inspections. Of the remaining 8 violations, 3 were repeated
(replacement documentation, service plan timeliness, and visits with youth in
placement) during this year's inspection and will need to be assessed as to why
the previous CAP was not effective and will require additional corrective action
planning. The 2024 CAP was successful in achieving compliance related to
personnel records, foster home licensure, initial service plan timeliness, and
independent living entry documentation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The report indicated internal process regarding case transfers and auditing
developed out of previous inspection CAPs helped maintain compliance during
transition. The chief administrator identified an increase in dependent youth with
chronic mental health needs, disruptive behavioral needs, and substance abuse
as an ongoing barrier to achieving compliance due to the time and attention
needed to secure appropriate placement, stabilize current placement, and ensure
appropriate services are being consistently provided. The chief administrator
identified compliance with the previous year's CAP related to the use of CQI to
engage staff to quickly address barriers, DCWL consultant periodic check in, as
well as program tech and management tracking data. Areas of the prior CAP that
were not successful were related to staff turnover and changes resulting in failure
to provide consistent communication required by several of the prior cap action
steps.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews

The staff members interviewed all reported there have been challenges this past
year with staffing losses and changes. They stated they receive support from their
immediate supervisors as well as the district manager and director. No concerns
were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The office appeared to have adequate space and equipment to provide for the
delivery of foster home certification, foster care, and independent living services.
Files are stored in a secured file room with locked cabinets containing closed
adoption files.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern.
Safety Alert: During a home visit on 11/12/2024, an unlicensed caregiver did not
have hot water due to the hot water heater not working.
Resolution: Kalamazoo DHHS staff completed a home visit on 12/13/2024 and
verified the hot water heater had been repaired and the home had hot water.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
March 4, 2025
_____________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 4, 2025
